name: 42 Macro
title: Is The Disinflation Process Still Intact?
text:
Synopsis
The disinflation process remains fragile, with inflation likely to firm up in late Q2 to early Q3, potentially triggering market disruptions and a global refinancing challenge, while simultaneously presenting opportunities in the AI sector.

Key Insights
- December CPI data showed mixed signals, with core categories showing divergent trends
- Disinflation process is intact but barely sustainable
- US inflation is unlikely to return to trend without a recession
- Inflation expected to accelerate appreciably in late Q2 to early Q3
- Anticipated rebuilding of treasury general account and shift in treasury net financing
- Potential global liquidity insufficiency during peak global debt refinancing
- Possible stock market crash anticipated in summer or sooner
- Expected market dip would likely be bought due to attractive valuations
- Potential opportunities in AI sector amid anticipated tax cuts and deregulation
